page.title: 09 TRADITIONS UPHELD
page.content:
{As Mottingham May Queen},I was to lead a procession on a bright sunny May weekend. I walked with a fiddler in front,my prince and crown bearer beside me and the dancing school behind me.We walked through Mottingham Village and into Dorset Road School. There I was crowned by the previous May Queen.I made a short speech and sat on the throne to watch the Maypole dancers majorettes perform.
Annual visits are made by 6 Eltham school children to Westminster Abbey,in order to lay flowers on the tomb of {Prince John of Eltham.}The son of Edward the 2nd.,he died fighting the Scots in 1336.Horn Park,Middle Park and Wyborne Primary Schools take part in this custom.The schools are all near to Eltham Palace.
